term.longtitle: IUPAC Gold Book - intrinsic viscosity of a polymer
term.title: intrinsic viscosity

item.text: The limiting value of the reduced viscosity, η_i/c or the inherent viscosity, η_inh, at infinite dilution of the polymer, i.e.

notes.item: This term is also known in the literature as the Staudinger index.
The unit must be specified; cm3 g-1 is recommended.

This quantity is neither a viscosity nor a pure number. The term is to be looked on as a traditional name. Any replacement by consistent terminology would produce unnecessary confusion in the polymer literature. Synonymous with limiting viscosity number.

item.title: inherent viscosity (of a polymer) (of a polymer)

item.alttext: η = lim c → 0 η i c = lim c → 0
